column4: does anyone know why i cannot run anything through sudo?  i try 'sudo ls' and get nothing, just back to the terminal.
then you have no files there
ls wont return anything if no files are there
dyrne: no, i can't do *anything*.  that's just my "obvious" test; this is in my ~.  i noticed this because i couldn't adjust the time or the start the network or users programs....
just try "sudo -s" and tell me if it changes u to "root"
no, keeps me listed as "andrew", according to my PS1.
hm that seems pretty messed up. perhaps ur sudo binary is broken.
i guess that's possible, though i just upgraded to the latest breezy version.
i was thinking it was just my user, but i created a test user and tested there with the same result.
does it actually ask u for ur user password when u try to sudo anything?
yeah, as you'd expect: the first time, and not after that for a while.
hmm, im sorry i dont know what to suggest, that seems like an odd problem. something iver never came across
but i don't get any errors or anything... 'sudo ls' returns nothing, as does 'gksudo users-admin' (after typing my password, of course, which does pop up)
lol... here's an older bug, and i've actually commented on it too: https://bugzilla.ubuntu.com/show_bug.cgi?id=9832
